detaileddescription.para: LwM2M client events are passed back to the event_cb function in lwm2m_rd_client_start()

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* lwm2m_observe_cb_t) (enum lwm2m_observe_event event, struct lwm2m_obj_path *path, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_observe_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Observe callback indicating observer adds and deletes, and notification ACKs and timeouts.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to user_data buffer, as provided in send_traceable_notification(). Used to determine for which data the ACKed/timed out notification was.

memberdef.definition: typedef void *(* lwm2m_engine_get_data_cb_t) (uint16_t obj_inst_id, uint16_t res_id, uint16_t res_inst_id, size_t *data_len)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uint16_t obj_inst_id, uint16_t res_id, uint16_t res_inst_id, size_t *data_len)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_engine_get_data_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Asynchronous callback to get a resource buffer and length.

detaileddescription.para: Prior to accessing the data buffer of a resource, the engine can use this callback to get the buffer pointer and length instead of using the resource's data buffer.
The client or LwM2M objects can register a function of this type via: lwm2m_engine_register_read_callback() lwm2m_engine_register_pre_write_callback()

parameterdescription.para: Object instance ID generating the callback.
Resource instance ID generating the callback (typically 0 for non-multi instance resources).

simplesect.para: Callback returns a pointer to the data buffer or NULL for failure.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* lwm2m_engine_set_data_cb_t) (uint16_t obj_inst_id, uint16_t res_id, uint16_t res_inst_id, uint8_t *data, uint16_t data_len, bool last_block, size_t total_size)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uint16_t obj_inst_id, uint16_t res_id, uint16_t res_inst_id, uint8_t *data, uint16_t data_len, bool last_block, size_t total_size)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_engine_set_data_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Asynchronous callback when data has been set to a resource buffer.

detaileddescription.para: After changing the data of a resource buffer, the LwM2M engine can make use of this callback to pass the data back to the client or LwM2M objects.
A function of this type can be registered via: lwm2m_engine_register_validate_callback() lwm2m_engine_register_post_write_callback()

parameterdescription.para: Object instance ID generating the callback.
Resource instance ID generating the callback (typically 0 for non-multi instance resources).
Flag used during block transfer to indicate the last block of data. For non-block transfers this is always false.
Expected total size of data for a block transfer. For non-block transfers this is 0.

simplesect.para: Callback returns a negative error code (errno.h) indicating reason of failure or 0 for success.

detaileddescription.para: Various object instance and resource-based events in the LwM2M engine can trigger a callback of this function type: object instance create, and object instance delete.
Register a function of this type via: lwm2m_engine_register_create_callback() lwm2m_engine_register_delete_callback()

parameterdescription.para: Object instance ID generating the callback.

simplesect.para: Callback returns a negative error code (errno.h) indicating reason of failure or 0 for success.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* lwm2m_engine_execute_cb_t) (uint16_t obj_inst_id, uint8_t *args, uint16_t args_len)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_engine_execute_cb_t

detaileddescription.para: Resource executes trigger a callback of this type.
Register a function of this type via: lwm2m_engine_register_exec_callback()

parameterdescription.para: Object instance ID generating the callback.
Pointer to execute arguments payload. (This can be NULL if no arguments are provided)
Length of argument payload in bytes.

simplesect.para: Callback returns a negative error code (errno.h) indicating reason of failure or 0 for success.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* lwm2m_ctx_event_cb_t) (struct lwm2m_ctx *ctx, enum lwm2m_rd_client_event event)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_ctx_event_cb_t

briefdescription.para: Register a new error code with LwM2M Device object.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients use this function to modify the pmin attribute for an observation being made. Example to update the pmin of a temperature sensor value being observed: lwm2m_engine_update_observer_min_period("3303/0/5700",5);

parameterdescription.para: Value of pmin to be given (in seconds).

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients use this function to modify the pmax attribute for an observation being made. Example to update the pmax of a temperature sensor value being observed: lwm2m_engine_update_observer_max_period("3303/0/5700",5);

parameterdescription.para: Value of pmax to be given (in seconds).

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients use this function to create non-default LwM2M objects: Example to create first temperature sensor object: lwm2m_engine_create_obj_inst("3303/0");

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients use this function to delete LwM2M objects.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.
0 for success or negative in case of error.

0 for success or negative in case of error.
0 for success or negative in case of error.
0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: Data buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: String buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: u8 buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: u16 buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: s64 buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: bool buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: double buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

parameterdescription.para: lwm2m_objlnk buffer to copy data into

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients can use this to set the callback function for resource reads.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This callback is triggered before setting the value of a resource. It can pass a special data buffer to the engine so that the actual resource value can be calculated later, etc.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This callback is triggered before setting the value of a resource to the resource data buffer.
The callback allows an LwM2M client or object to validate the data before writing and notify an error if the data should be discarded for any reason (by returning a negative error code).

simplesect.para: All resources that have a validation callback registered are initially decoded into a temporary validation buffer. Make sure that CONFIG_LWM2M_ENGINE_VALIDATION_BUFFER_SIZE is large enough to store each of the validated resources (individually).
0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This callback is triggered after setting the value of a resource to the resource data buffer.
It allows an LwM2M client or object to post-process the value of a resource or trigger other related resource calculations.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: This event is triggered when the execute method of a resource is enabled.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Set object instance create event callback.

detaileddescription.para: This event is triggered when an object instance is created.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Set object instance delete event callback.

detaileddescription.para: This event is triggered when an object instance is deleted.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *pathstr, void *data_ptr, uint16_t data_len, uint8_t data_flags)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_engine_set_res_data

briefdescription.para: Set data buffer for a resource.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to set the data buffer and flags for the specified LwM2M resource.

parameterdescription.para: Data buffer flags (such as read-only, etc)

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Get data buffer for a resource.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to get the data buffer information for the specified LwM2M resource.

parameterdescription.para: Data buffer flags (such as read-only, etc)

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients use this function to create multi-resource instances: Example to create 0 instance of device available power sources: lwm2m_engine_create_res_inst("3/0/6/0");

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: Use this function to remove an existing resource instance

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Update the period of a given service.

detaileddescription.para: Allow the period modification on an existing service created with lwm2m_engine_add_service(). Example to frequency at which a periodic_service changes it's values : lwm2m_engine_update_service(device_periodic_service,5*MSEC_PER_SEC);

parameterdescription.para: New period for the periodic_service (in milliseconds)

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Update the period of the device service.

detaileddescription.para: Change the duration of the periodic device service that notifies the current time.

parameterdescription.para: New period for the device service (in milliseconds)

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M clients normally do not need to call this function as it is called by lwm2m_rd_client_start(). However, if the client does not use the RD client implementation, it will need to be called manually.

simplesect.para: 0 for success or negative in case of error.

briefdescription.para: Acknowledge the currently processed request with an empty ACK.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M engine by default sends piggybacked responses for requests. This function allows to send an empty ACK for a request earlier (from the application callback). The LwM2M engine will then send the actual response as a separate CON message after all callbacks are executed.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct lwm2m_ctx *client_ctx, const char *ep_name, uint32_t flags, lwm2m_ctx_event_cb_t event_cb, lwm2m_observe_cb_t observe_cb)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_rd_client_start

briefdescription.para: Start the LwM2M RD (Registration / Discovery) Client.

detaileddescription.para: The RD client sits just above the LwM2M engine and performs the necessary actions to implement the "Registration interface". For more information see Section 5.3 "Client Registration Interface" of the LwM2M Technical Specification.
NOTE: lwm2m_engine_start() is called automatically by this function.

parameterdescription.para: Flags used to configure current LwM2M session.
Observe callback function called when an observer was added or deleted, and when a notification was acked or has timed out

detaileddescription.para: The RD client sits just above the LwM2M engine and performs the necessary actions to implement the "Registration interface". For more information see Section 5.3 "Client Registration Interface" of the LwM2M Technical Specification.

parameterdescription.para: True to deregister the client if registered. False to force close the connection.

briefdescription.para: Trigger a Registration Update of the LwM2M RD Client.
Helper function to print path objects' contents to log.

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to use for formatting the string

simplesect.para: Resulting formatted path string

briefdescription.para: LwM2M Objects managed by OMA for LwM2M tech specification. Objects in this range have IDs from 0 to 1023. For more information refer to Technical Specification OMA-TS-LightweightM2M-V1_0_2-20180209-A.

LwM2M Objects produced by 3rd party Standards Development Organizations. Objects in this range have IDs from 2048 to 10240 Refer to the OMA LightweightM2M (LwM2M) Object and Resource Registry: http://www.openmobilealliance.org/wp/OMNA/LwM2M/LwM2MRegistry.html.
Power source types used for the "Available Power Sources" resource of the LwM2M Device object.
Error codes used for the "Error Code" resource of the LwM2M Device object. An LwM2M client can register one of the following error codes via the lwm2m_device_add_err() function.

Battery status codes used for the "Battery Status" resource (3/0/20) of the LwM2M Device object. As the battery status changes, an LwM2M client can set one of the following codes via: lwm2m_engine_set_u8("3/0/20", [battery status])

detaileddescription.para: An LwM2M client or the LwM2M Firmware Update object use the following codes to represent the LwM2M Firmware Update state (5/0/3).

briefdescription.para: LWM2M Firmware Update object result codes.

detaileddescription.para: After processing a firmware update, the client sets the result via one of the following codes via lwm2m_engine_set_u8("5/0/5", [result code])

briefdescription.para: Maximum value for ObjLnk resource fields.
Run bootstrap procedure in current session.

detaileddescription.para: LwM2M high-level interface is defined in this header.

simplesect.para: The implementation assumes UDP module is enabled.
LwM2M 1.0.x is currently the only supported version.
